class.name: PopupMenu
class.brief_description: A modal window used to display a list of options.
class.description: [PopupMenu] is a modal window used to display a list of options. Useful for toolbars and context menus. The size of a [PopupMenu] can be limited by using [member Window.max_size]. If the height of the list of items is larger than the maximum height of the [PopupMenu], a [ScrollContainer] within the popup will allow the user to scroll the contents. If no maximum size is set, or if it is set to [code]0[/code], the [PopupMenu] height will be limited by its parent rect. All [code]set_*[/code] methods allow negative item indices, i.e. [code]-1[/code] to access the last item, [code]-2[/code] to select the second-to-last item, and so on. [b]Incremental search:[/b] Like [ItemList] and [Tree], [PopupMenu] supports searching within the list while the control is focused. Press a key that matches the first letter of an item's name to select the first item starting with the given letter. After that point, there are two ways to perform incremental search: 1) Press the same key again before the timeout duration to select the next item starting with the same letter. 2) Press letter keys that match the rest of the word before the timeout duration to match to select the item in question directly. Both of these actions will be reset to the beginning of the list if the timeout duration has passed since the last keystroke was registered. You can adjust the timeout duration by changing [member ProjectSettings.gui/timers/incremental_search_max_interval_msec]. [b]Note:[/b] The ID values used for items are limited to 32 bits, not full 64 bits of [int]. This has a range of [code]-2^32[/code] to [code]2^32 - 1[/code], i.e. [code]-2147483648[/code] to [code]2147483647[/code].

method.name: activate_item_by_event
method.description: Checks the provided [param event] against the [PopupMenu]'s shortcuts and accelerators, and activates the first item with matching events. If [param for_global_only] is [code]true[/code], only shortcuts and accelerators with [code]global[/code] set to [code]true[/code] will be called. Returns [code]true[/code] if an item was successfully activated. [b]Note:[/b] Certain [Control]s, such as [MenuButton], will call this method automatically.

method.name: add_check_item
method.description: Adds a new checkable item with text [param label]. An [param id] can optionally be provided, as well as an accelerator ([param accel]). If no [param id] is provided, one will be created from the index. If no [param accel] is provided, then the default value of 0 (corresponding to [constant @GlobalScope.KEY_NONE]) will be assigned to the item (which means it won't have any accelerator). See [method get_item_accelerator] for more info on accelerators. [b]Note:[/b] Checkable items just display a checkmark, but don't have any built-in checking behavior and must be checked/unchecked manually. See [method set_item_checked] for more info on how to control it.

method.name: add_check_shortcut
method.description: Adds a new checkable item and assigns the specified [Shortcut] to it. Sets the label of the checkbox to the [Shortcut]'s name. An [param id] can optionally be provided. If no [param id] is provided, one will be created from the index. [b]Note:[/b] Checkable items just display a checkmark, but don't have any built-in checking behavior and must be checked/unchecked manually. See [method set_item_checked] for more info on how to control it.

method.name: add_icon_check_item
method.description: Adds a new checkable item with text [param label] and icon [param texture]. An [param id] can optionally be provided, as well as an accelerator ([param accel]). If no [param id] is provided, one will be created from the index. If no [param accel] is provided, then the default value of 0 (corresponding to [constant @GlobalScope.KEY_NONE]) will be assigned to the item (which means it won't have any accelerator). See [method get_item_accelerator] for more info on accelerators. [b]Note:[/b] Checkable items just display a checkmark, but don't have any built-in checking behavior and must be checked/unchecked manually. See [method set_item_checked] for more info on how to control it.

method.name: add_icon_check_shortcut
method.description: Adds a new checkable item and assigns the specified [Shortcut] and icon [param texture] to it. Sets the label of the checkbox to the [Shortcut]'s name. An [param id] can optionally be provided. If no [param id] is provided, one will be created from the index. [b]Note:[/b] Checkable items just display a checkmark, but don't have any built-in checking behavior and must be checked/unchecked manually. See [method set_item_checked] for more info on how to control it.

method.name: add_icon_item
method.description: Adds a new item with text [param label] and icon [param texture]. An [param id] can optionally be provided, as well as an accelerator ([param accel]). If no [param id] is provided, one will be created from the index. If no [param accel] is provided, then the default value of 0 (corresponding to [constant @GlobalScope.KEY_NONE]) will be assigned to the item (which means it won't have any accelerator). See [method get_item_accelerator] for more info on accelerators.

method.name: add_icon_radio_check_item
method.description: Same as [method add_icon_check_item], but uses a radio check button.

method.name: add_icon_radio_check_shortcut
method.description: Same as [method add_icon_check_shortcut], but uses a radio check button.

method.name: add_icon_shortcut
method.description: Adds a new item and assigns the specified [Shortcut] and icon [param texture] to it. Sets the label of the checkbox to the [Shortcut]'s name. An [param id] can optionally be provided. If no [param id] is provided, one will be created from the index. If [param allow_echo] is [code]true[/code], the shortcut can be activated with echo events.

method.name: add_item
method.description: Adds a new item with text [param label]. An [param id] can optionally be provided, as well as an accelerator ([param accel]). If no [param id] is provided, one will be created from the index. If no [param accel] is provided, then the default value of 0 (corresponding to [constant @GlobalScope.KEY_NONE]) will be assigned to the item (which means it won't have any accelerator). See [method get_item_accelerator] for more info on accelerators. [b]Note:[/b] The provided [param id] is used only in [signal id_pressed] and [signal id_focused] signals. It's not related to the [code]index[/code] arguments in e.g. [method set_item_checked].

method.name: add_multistate_item
method.description:
Adds a new multistate item with text [param label]. Contrarily to normal binary items, multistate items can have more than two states, as defined by [param max_states]. The default value is defined by [param default_state]. An [param id] can optionally be provided, as well as an accelerator ([param accel]). If no [param id] is provided, one will be created from the index. If no [param accel] is provided, then the default value of 0 (corresponding to [constant @GlobalScope.KEY_NONE]) will be assigned to the item (which means it won't have any accelerator). See [method get_item_accelerator] for more info on accelerators. [codeblock] func _ready(): add_multistate_item("Item", 3, 0)
index_pressed.connect(func(index: int): toggle_item_multistate(index) match get_item_multistate(index): 0: print("First state") 1: print("Second state") 2: print("Third state") ) [/codeblock] [b]Note:[/b] Multistate items don't update their state automatically and must be done manually. See [method toggle_item_multistate], [method set_item_multistate] and [method get_item_multistate] for more info on how to control it.

method.name: add_radio_check_item
method.description: Adds a new radio check button with text [param label]. An [param id] can optionally be provided, as well as an accelerator ([param accel]). If no [param id] is provided, one will be created from the index. If no [param accel] is provided, then the default value of 0 (corresponding to [constant @GlobalScope.KEY_NONE]) will be assigned to the item (which means it won't have any accelerator). See [method get_item_accelerator] for more info on accelerators. [b]Note:[/b] Checkable items just display a checkmark, but don't have any built-in checking behavior and must be checked/unchecked manually. See [method set_item_checked] for more info on how to control it.

method.name: add_radio_check_shortcut
method.description: Adds a new radio check button and assigns a [Shortcut] to it. Sets the label of the checkbox to the [Shortcut]'s name. An [param id] can optionally be provided. If no [param id] is provided, one will be created from the index. [b]Note:[/b] Checkable items just display a checkmark, but don't have any built-in checking behavior and must be checked/unchecked manually. See [method set_item_checked] for more info on how to control it.

method.name: add_separator
method.description: Adds a separator between items. Separators also occupy an index, which you can set by using the [param id] parameter. A [param label] can optionally be provided, which will appear at the center of the separator.

method.name: add_shortcut
method.description: Adds a [Shortcut]. An [param id] can optionally be provided. If no [param id] is provided, one will be created from the index. If [param allow_echo] is [code]true[/code], the shortcut can be activated with echo events.

method.name: add_submenu_item
method.description: Adds an item that will act as a submenu of the parent [PopupMenu] node when clicked. The [param submenu] argument must be the name of an existing [PopupMenu] that has been added as a child to this node. This submenu will be shown when the item is clicked, hovered for long enough, or activated using the [code]ui_select[/code] or [code]ui_right[/code] input actions. An [param id] can optionally be provided. If no [param id] is provided, one will be created from the index.

method.name: add_submenu_node_item
method.description: Adds an item that will act as a submenu of the parent [PopupMenu] node when clicked. This submenu will be shown when the item is clicked, hovered for long enough, or activated using the [code]ui_select[/code] or [code]ui_right[/code] input actions. [param submenu] must be either child of this [PopupMenu] or has no parent node (in which case it will be automatically added as a child). If the [param submenu] popup has another parent, this method will fail. An [param id] can optionally be provided. If no [param id] is provided, one will be created from the index.

method.name: clear
method.description: Removes all items from the [PopupMenu]. If [param free_submenus] is [code]true[/code], the submenu nodes are automatically freed.

method.name: get_focused_item
method.description: Returns the index of the currently focused item. Returns [code]-1[/code] if no item is focused.

method.name: get_item_accelerator
method.description: Returns the accelerator of the item at the given [param index]. An accelerator is a keyboard shortcut that can be pressed to trigger the menu button even if it's not currently open. The return value is an integer which is generally a combination of [enum KeyModifierMask]s and [enum Key]s using bitwise OR such as [code]KEY_MASK_CTRL | KEY_A[/code] ([kbd]Ctrl + A[/kbd]). If no accelerator is defined for the specified [param index], [method get_item_accelerator] returns [code]0[/code] (corresponding to [constant @GlobalScope.KEY_NONE]).

method.name: get_item_auto_translate_mode
method.description: Returns the auto translate mode of the item at the given [param index].

method.name: get_item_icon
method.description: Returns the icon of the item at the given [param index].

method.name: get_item_icon_max_width
method.description: Returns the maximum allowed width of the icon for the item at the given [param index].

method.name: get_item_icon_modulate
method.description: Returns a [Color] modulating the item's icon at the given [param index].

method.name: get_item_id
method.description: Returns the ID of the item at the given [param index]. [code]id[/code] can be manually assigned, while index can not.

method.name: get_item_indent
method.description: Returns the horizontal offset of the item at the given [param index].

method.name: get_item_index
method.description: Returns the index of the item containing the specified [param id]. Index is automatically assigned to each item by the engine and can not be set manually.

method.name: get_item_language
method.description: Returns item's text language code.

method.name: get_item_metadata
method.description: Returns the metadata of the specified item, which might be of any type. You can set it with [method set_item_metadata], which provides a simple way of assigning context data to items.

method.name: get_item_multistate
method.description: Returns the state of the item at the given [param index].

method.name: get_item_multistate_max
method.description: Returns the max states of the item at the given [param index].

method.name: get_item_shortcut
method.description: Returns the [Shortcut] associated with the item at the given [param index].

method.name: get_item_submenu
method.description: Returns the submenu name of the item at the given [param index]. See [method add_submenu_item] for more info on how to add a submenu.

method.name: get_item_submenu_node
method.description: Returns the submenu of the item at the given [param index], or [code]null[/code] if no submenu was added. See [method add_submenu_node_item] for more info on how to add a submenu.

method.name: get_item_text
method.description: Returns the text of the item at the given [param index].

method.name: get_item_text_direction
method.description: Returns item's text base writing direction.

method.name: get_item_tooltip
method.description: Returns the tooltip associated with the item at the given [param index].

method.name: is_item_checkable
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the item at the given [param index] is checkable in some way, i.e. if it has a checkbox or radio button. [b]Note:[/b] Checkable items just display a checkmark or radio button, but don't have any built-in checking behavior and must be checked/unchecked manually.

method.name: is_item_checked
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the item at the given [param index] is checked.

method.name: is_item_disabled
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the item at the given [param index] is disabled. When it is disabled it can't be selected, or its action invoked. See [method set_item_disabled] for more info on how to disable an item.

method.name: is_item_radio_checkable
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the item at the given [param index] has radio button-style checkability. [b]Note:[/b] This is purely cosmetic; you must add the logic for checking/unchecking items in radio groups.

method.name: is_item_separator
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the item is a separator. If it is, it will be displayed as a line. See [method add_separator] for more info on how to add a separator.

method.name: is_item_shortcut_disabled
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the specified item's shortcut is disabled.

method.name: is_native_menu
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the system native menu is supported and currently used by this [PopupMenu].

method.name: is_system_menu
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the menu is bound to the special system menu.

method.name: remove_item
method.description: Removes the item at the given [param index] from the menu. [b]Note:[/b] The indices of items after the removed item will be shifted by one.

method.name: scroll_to_item
method.description: Moves the scroll view to make the item at the given [param index] visible.

method.name: set_focused_item
method.description: Sets the currently focused item as the given [param index]. Passing [code]-1[/code] as the index makes so that no item is focused.

method.name: set_item_accelerator
method.description: Sets the accelerator of the item at the given [param index]. An accelerator is a keyboard shortcut that can be pressed to trigger the menu button even if it's not currently open. [param accel] is generally a combination of [enum KeyModifierMask]s and [enum Key]s using bitwise OR such as [code]KEY_MASK_CTRL | KEY_A[/code] ([kbd]Ctrl + A[/kbd]).

method.name: set_item_as_checkable
method.description: Sets whether the item at the given [param index] has a checkbox. If [code]false[/code], sets the type of the item to plain text. [b]Note:[/b] Checkable items just display a checkmark, but don't have any built-in checking behavior and must be checked/unchecked manually.

method.name: set_item_as_radio_checkable
method.description: Sets the type of the item at the given [param index] to radio button. If [code]false[/code], sets the type of the item to plain text.

method.name: set_item_as_separator
method.description: Mark the item at the given [param index] as a separator, which means that it would be displayed as a line. If [code]false[/code], sets the type of the item to plain text.

method.name: set_item_auto_translate_mode
method.description: Sets the auto translate mode of the item at the given [param index]. Items use [constant Node.AUTO_TRANSLATE_MODE_INHERIT] by default, which uses the same auto translate mode as the [PopupMenu] itself.

method.name: set_item_checked
method.description: Sets the checkstate status of the item at the given [param index].

method.name: set_item_disabled
method.description: Enables/disables the item at the given [param index]. When it is disabled, it can't be selected and its action can't be invoked.

method.name: set_item_icon
method.description: Replaces the [Texture2D] icon of the item at the given [param index].

method.name: set_item_icon_max_width
method.description: Sets the maximum allowed width of the icon for the item at the given [param index]. This limit is applied on top of the default size of the icon and on top of [theme_item icon_max_width]. The height is adjusted according to the icon's ratio.

method.name: set_item_icon_modulate
method.description: Sets a modulating [Color] of the item's icon at the given [param index].

method.name: set_item_id
method.description: Sets the [param id] of the item at the given [param index]. The [param id] is used in [signal id_pressed] and [signal id_focused] signals.

method.name: set_item_indent
method.description: Sets the horizontal offset of the item at the given [param index].

method.name: set_item_language
method.description: Sets language code of item's text used for line-breaking and text shaping algorithms, if left empty current locale is used instead.

method.name: set_item_metadata
method.description: Sets the metadata of an item, which may be of any type. You can later get it with [method get_item_metadata], which provides a simple way of assigning context data to items.

method.name: set_item_multistate
method.description: Sets the state of a multistate item. See [method add_multistate_item] for details.

method.name: set_item_multistate_max
method.description: Sets the max states of a multistate item. See [method add_multistate_item] for details.

method.name: set_item_shortcut
method.description: Sets a [Shortcut] for the item at the given [param index].

method.name: set_item_shortcut_disabled
method.description: Disables the [Shortcut] of the item at the given [param index].

method.name: set_item_submenu
method.description: Sets the submenu of the item at the given [param index]. The submenu is the name of a child [PopupMenu] node that would be shown when the item is clicked.

method.name: set_item_submenu_node
method.description: Sets the submenu of the item at the given [param index]. The submenu is a [PopupMenu] node that would be shown when the item is clicked. It must either be a child of this [PopupMenu] or has no parent (in which case it will be automatically added as a child). If the [param submenu] popup has another parent, this method will fail.

method.name: set_item_text
method.description: Sets the text of the item at the given [param index].

method.name: set_item_text_direction
method.description: Sets item's text base writing direction.

method.name: set_item_tooltip
method.description: Sets the [String] tooltip of the item at the given [param index].

method.name: toggle_item_checked
method.description: Toggles the check state of the item at the given [param index].

method.name: toggle_item_multistate
method.description: Cycle to the next state of a multistate item. See [method add_multistate_item] for details.

signal.name: id_focused
signal.description: Emitted when the user navigated to an item of some [param id] using the [member ProjectSettings.input/ui_up] or [member ProjectSettings.input/ui_down] input action.

signal.name: id_pressed
signal.description: Emitted when an item of some [param id] is pressed or its accelerator is activated. [b]Note:[/b] If [param id] is negative (either explicitly or due to overflow), this will return the corresponding index instead.

signal.name: index_pressed
signal.description: Emitted when an item of some [param index] is pressed or its accelerator is activated.

signal.name: menu_changed
signal.description: Emitted when any item is added, modified or removed.
